name: Phobos
description: Phobos is the larger and closer of the two moons of Mars. It is one of the smallest moons in the Solar System and is heavily cratered, with a surface dominated by grooves and chains of craters. Phobos is gradually moving closer to Mars and is predicted to either collide with the planet or break up into a ring due to tidal forces.
rotation_period: Synchronous rotation; same as its orbital period (about 7.7 hours)

gallery.description: Phobos' surface showing grooves and crater chains

interesting_facts: Phobos is the larger and closer of the two moons of Mars.
Phobos is one of the smallest moons in the Solar System.
Its surface is heavily cratered, with grooves and chains of craters dominating the landscape.
Phobos is gradually moving closer to Mars due to tidal forces.
There is a possibility that Phobos may either collide with Mars or break up into a ring in the future.
Phobos has a very short rotation period of about 7.7 hours.
Its orbit is so close to Mars that it takes only about 0.319 days to complete one revolution.
Phobos' surface temperatures range from around -4°C (25°F) to -112°C (-170°F).
